thread.title: Hurricane storms past Tucker County 41-39

author: The Herald-Dispatch
title: Hurricane storms past Tucker County 41-39
text:
HAMBLETON, W.Va. — Hurricane got 19 points from Alex Anderson and outscored Tucker County 13-10 in the fourth quarter to knock off the host Mountain Lions 41-39 in the Mount Storm Power Station Holiday Classic title game on Friday.
Gabby Quijano dropped in a pair of 3-pointers for Hurricane in the pivotal fourth quarter. She scored nine points. Taylor Manley added eight.
Hurricane’s Anderson and Kendall Anderson were named to the All-Tournament Team.
Brylee Wetzel tallied 10 points for Tucker County, which was 2 for 6 from the foul line in the fourth quarter. The Mountain Lions were 9 for 18 for the game from the charity stripe, while Hurricane was 4 for 8.
HURRICANE 10 15 3 13 — 41: A. Anderson 19, Dempsey 0, Manley 8, Whitman 0, Bielinski 2, Quijano 9, K. Andersoln 3, Jeffrey 0.
TUCKER COUNTY 5 13 11 10 — 39: Evans 4, Gross 4, Matthews 6, Wetzel 10, Mac. Helmick 3, Zirk 9, Mad. Helmick 3.
WAYNE 67, JAMES WOOD (VIRGINIA) 35: Brooke Adkins scored 27 points, Jayce Sammons 18 and Laneigh Brooks 12 as the Pioneers (9-0) walloped the Colonels (4-8) in a tournament in Maryland.
Earlier in the event, Sammons scored 37 points as Wayne beat Springdale (Maryland) Prep 67-39.
Boys basketball
CABELL MIDLAND 75, TVC 68: The Knights (2-3) rallied from 10 points down to defeat Teays Valley Christian (6-4) at the Summersville Winter Classic.
Ethan Blackburn scored 20 points, grabbed 11 rebounds and issued four assists for Cabell Midland. Evan Hughes scored 22 points and grabbed six rebounds. Nathan Jones scored 13 points and pulled down 16 rebounds. Aidan Ray scored 14 points.
TUG VALLEY 74, HUNTINGTON ST. JOE 54: Braydun Ferris combined 18 points with eight assists to lead the Panthers (3-0) past the Irish (2-2) in the Kaydence Maynard Memorial Christmas Classic.
Kaden Hale scored 17 points, Ashton Davis 14 and Bryson Elia 13 for Tug Valley. Miciah Ehirim and Grady Paynter each scored 14 points for St. Joe. Gavin Polan tossed in 11.
WEBB (TENNESSEE) 65, BOYD COUNTY 63: The Lions rallied to outscore the Spartans 24-17 in the third quarter to take a lead in the Cumberland Falls Invitational Tournament title game on Saturday night, but Webb found four more points in the fourth quarter than Boyd County in Corbin, Kentucky.
Alex Leeth scored 15 points and Cameron Swearengen and Drake Ingram chipped in 13 apiece for the Spartans.
Jacob Spurlock led all scorers with 29 points for the Lions (10-3). Rhett Holbrook netted 16. They dropped in five and four 3-pointers, respectively.
WEBB 16 16 17 16 — 65: Lentz 9, Pompey 9, Bowers 3, Swearengen 13, Leeth 15, Luton 3, Ingram 13.
BOYD COUNTY 12 15 24 12 — 63: Holbrook 16, Taylor 7, Ellis 6, Spurlock 29, Hicks 3, Martin 2, Smith 0.
SOUTH WEBSTER 57, FAIRLAND 53: The Jeeps (8-0) built a 15-point lead and held off the Dragons at Alexander High School in Albany, Ohio.
Fairland (5-3) closed within 53-50 with 27 seconds left, but moved no closer as South Webster coach Norm Persin won his 786th career game.
Eli Roberts paced the Jeeps with 31 points. Jack Timothy chipped in 11. Chase Allen scored 33 points for the Dragons. Brody Buchanan scored 10.
FAIRLAND 8 14 15 16 — 53: Davis 4, Allen 33, Hunt 0, Lochow 0, Marcum 4, Fransen 0, Smith 2, Buchanan 10, Jackson 0.
SOUTH WEBSTER 13 20 10 14 — 57: Roberts 31, White 0, Shupert 3, Campbell 3, Timothy 11, Sommer 4.
WAYNE 74, WESTSIDE 66: Isaac Meddings led the Pioneers (2-5) with 32 points in a triumph over the Renegades (4-2) in the Tug Valley Christmas Shootout. Ronnie Stanley scored 14 points and Cooper Adkins 11 for Wayne.
Meddings also scored 20 points in a loss to Tug Valley.
JACKSON 53, GALLIA ACADEMY 52: Boston Campbell’s 18-point effort sparked the host Ironmen (7-4) by the Blue Devils (2-6). Bodhi Wolford backed Campbell with 14 points.
Kenyon Franklin led Gallia Academy, which led 41-40 with 3:17 remaining, with 23 points. Cade Mock scored 14.
WHEELERSBURG 68, PORTSMOUTH 51: Former Trojan Devon Lattimore bedeviled his old team with 25 points in a battle of 6-1 squads.
Braylon Rucker scored 20 points and Landon McGraw snared 14 rebounds for the Pirates. Deandre Berry paced Portsmouth with 23 points. Donnovan Breech added 16 points.
MEIGS 65, EASTERN MEIGS 41: Freshman Reed Brinager scored 26 points to lead the Marauders (7-2) to their sixth consecutive victory. The Eagles fell to 0-9.
Wrestling
SKYLLINE INVITATIONAL: Huntington High won the Skyline Invitational at Gallia Academy in Centenary, Ohio.
The Highlanders finished with 298 points. Owen Woodrum won the 113-pound class. Joe Riggs took the 144-pound division title.
